title: King Charlges III Coronation Medal Ceremony
description: Congratulations to Branch President Donna Sampson and Branch First Vice President William Law on being presented with the King Charles III Coronation medal by MP James Maloney before a full house at Branch 643 on March 4th.

title: Remembrance Day 2024
description: Branch 643 welcomed members from the public and local elementary students to our 2024 Remembrance Day service.

title: Veterans Resources
description: The Legion provides assistance, always free of charge, to any person who is serving or who has honourably served in the Canadian Armed Forces, the Commonwealth or its wartime allies, or as a Regular Member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, or as a Peace Officer in a Special Duty Area or on a Special Duty Operation, or who has served in the Merchant Navy or Ferry Command during wartime. The Legion also assists their eligible family members.

title: Royal Canadian Legion #643 Amalgamation
description1: On March 11, members of the Royal Canadian Legion Branch #3 and Branch #210 invited friends and family to celebrate the amalgamation of both branches to create the new Branch #643, named after Flt. Lt. David Hornell, VC.
description2: This was a special celebration where both branches united their strengths and ideas in order to make service to their members even better.
description3: Dignitaries of the Ontario Command were present at the event. Brian Weaver, President of the Ontario Command, and Donna Sampson, Chairman of the Amalgamation Committee, introduced the official documents from Ottawa that decreed the new RCL Branch #643. Debbie Olmstead, 1st Vice Ontario Commander for the Ladies Auxiliary; Doreene Corstorphine, Ladies Auxiliary Zone Commander D-1; and Helene Simpson, Ladies Auxiliary Past President of Branch #3, also displayed the document on behalf of the Ladies Auxiliary. After the presentation, everyone was invited to the dance floor to enjoy the party!
